alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 15 at 4:31PM CDT until June 15 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN JUNEAU AND NORTHWESTERN ADAMS COUNTIES... At 429 PM CDT, a confirmed large and extremely dangerous tornado was located 10 miles northwest of Necedah, or 14 miles northeast of Tomah, moving northeast at 30 mph. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Damaging tornado continues. Radar indicates a continued stream of debris lofted into the air from the tornado. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. Locations impacted include... Strongs Prairie, Cutler, Finley, New Miner, Monroe Center, Sprague, Mather, The Necedah Wildlife Refuge and The Sprague Mather Flowage. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: A large and extremely dangerous tornado is on the ground. take immediate tornado precautions. this is an emergency situation.
